Chemical Actions and Uses/Specialty Uses of Chemicals/Chelating Agents/Iron Chelating Agents
Record.Description: Organic chemicals that form two or more coordination links with an iron ion. Once coordination has occurred, the complex formed is called a chelate. The iron-binding porphyrin group of hemoglobin is an example of a metal chelate found in biological systems.
